website_summaries.verdict: A rock climbing shoe that is both astonishingly comfortable and breathable points heavily to the Black Diamond Momentum Lace. It is also an amazingly budget-friendly climbing gear that grabs on edges relentlessly.What it is not, unfortunately, is a shoe with a one-to-one fit. Nevertheless, the Momentum Lace from Black Diamond shines on virtually all fronts, and those who would choose to send projects in it would only be witnesses to the exciting things it can do.
pros: Quite a number of those who have tested the Black Diamond Momentum Lace say that its level of comfort is simply off the charts
Its breathability is nothing short of remarkable, many climbers say
Several of those who have purchased this exemplary rock climbing shoe love its stunningly affordable price tag
The men’s and women’s Black Diamond Momentum Lace handles edges well, say some wearers
About a handful of patrons highly recommends it to beginners
This incredible climbing footgear from Black Diamond is super lightweight, according to a few
The Momentum Lace’s adhesive prowess is impressive, say a couple of climbing enthusiasts
cons: It runs narrow, a few of those who have bought it say
The knit material stretches slightly over time, one user has mentioned

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, great for gym climbing.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great, especially for indoor climbing. I have used these for several climbs now and they are holding up great. I ordered these 1 size smaller than my street shoe size and the fit is pretty spot on. Would strongly recommend for a first pair of climbing shoes or for a pair of gym shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not for wider feet
customer_reviews.text: Well made, and looks really grippy, but my feet were horribly squished along the sides and crunched in the toe-box (not in a 'it'll loosen up' way at all). My feet aren't super wide either, but I ended up returning these and going with a pair of Sportiva's Tarantulace. Much more accomodating for width.
customer_reviews.author: Derek A. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Sizing issue
customer_reviews.text: I am a moderate level female boulder-er and know how feet should feel in climbing shoes. I am normally a size 7 in Women's. Based on Black Diamond brand I bought a size 6 men's Momentum. They were laughably too small. Nice looking shoes though! (For moderate climbers - no, these are not moderate level, I purposely wanted a flater shoe for what I am climbing.
customer_reviews.author: hi people

customer_reviews.title: My first pair of climbing shoes - love them!
customer_reviews.text: Another review suggested getting these as your first climbing shoes, so I did. They're excellent! They quality is great and I haven't had a single issue climbing. I normally wear size 11, got 11.5. That was perfect - they're tight but not bothersome in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim P.

customer_reviews.title: Sized super small.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews and they all said these were sized like street shoes. I wear a 9.5-10. I ordered a 9.5, wanting them snug. I literally couldn't get my foot in. I had my son, who wears an 8 try them on and they were too small for him. They were just slightly big on my daughter, who wears a 6!
customer_reviews.author: MWent

customer_reviews.title: Climbing shoe runs really small!
customer_reviews.text: Read several reviews regarding the size running small, but only decided to go 1 size up from my original street wear size (5.5m to 6.5m). Ended up having to return them and rebuy 2 sizes up (7.5m). They're arriving tonight, hopefully will fit perfectly this time. Other than the sizing issue, the shoes look great!
customer_reviews.author: Reah

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for someone beyond beginner
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as my first pair of climbing shoes after countless sessions of renting them. I really like how they feel on my feet and although I'm only projecting V1-V3 bouldering routes at this time, I feel like these are an amazing step up from the rental shoes - definitely recommend for anyone looking to make that step out of the renting game!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Comfy, Also choose the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I like how the quality of this product really shows and how comfortable the shoes are. The only problem is that I accidentally ordered a size to small and climbing shoes are already built to be a little smaller than a normal shoe. Everything is perfectly fine after that.
customer_reviews.author: Chanderson425

customer_reviews.title: Run smaller then a normal climbing shoe would
customer_reviews.text: Buy a size much larger, bought a pair two sizes up and had to exchange them for a pair 3 sizes up
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality climbing shoes
customer_reviews.text: First pair of climbing shoes. Been using them for about a month. Ordered a half size up and they fit perfectly. I suppose my next pair I may buy a little tighter and work at really breaking them in. I’m very impressed with these shoes though.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Can you really love shoes that are too small and hurt your toes? Well I love these!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Size Up
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoe, but consider going a size up from what you regularly wear.
customer_reviews.author: Moucomics

customer_reviews.title: Run very small
customer_reviews.text: I wear a10.5 - 11 street shoe. Had to get a 12 and is still very tight, no wiggle room at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beginner climber
customer_reviews.text: I started climbing a few months ago and these are perfect. Looks cool and lots of rubber to spare
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: shoes run small
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 11 us mens but I can actually fit into 10.5's. I ordered this shoe in a size 11 and could hardly fit them onto my feet. Seller should state that sizes run small in product description.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Spring

customer_reviews.title: Go a size up
customer_reviews.text: Go at least a half size up. I put them on with socks on and I couldn’t last more than 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Bigsy

customer_reviews.title: Solid stiff shoe at a good price! Be careful about the sizing.
customer_reviews.text: Solid feeling shoes. Much better than the rentals my indoor gym hands out. I’m mainly an indoor climber and these stuff shoes help me use the small chips on the walls with confidence. The price is great compared to other beginner/intermediate shoes. Love the look too.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Voss

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for my first pair!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as my first climbing shoes and so far they have functioned perfectly and I have already received plenty of compliments!
customer_reviews.author: brandoshih

customer_reviews.title: Get a size bigger...
customer_reviews.text: Seem like great shoes, but had to return because my toes we're curled with my regular shoe size. Maybe get a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Fox

customer_reviews.title: What's with the sizing? Third times a charm
customer_reviews.text: Took us 3 orders and 2 returns to finally get the right size. These are for my 17 year old daughter who wears a size 9 women's shoe normally. We ordered a men's size 10! and they finally fit! The shoe is great, but the sizing is way off from street shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Linda V White

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy these shoes twice because they were too small the first time. First time, I got 2 sizes bigger then what my shoes size is for Vans. Then, I got 2.5 sizes bigger then my shoe size, and they fit. Ex: I’m a size 7.5 and I ordered a size 10 and they fit.
customer_reviews.author: Malory Coronis

customer_reviews.title: Great fit but sizing sucks
customer_reviews.text: They didn't fit at all i got a 12 and in street shoes I'm at 11.5 so I reordered them at a 13 and they haven't arrived yet
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but sized very small
customer_reviews.text: Sized very small, but once you get the right size they are very comfortable. Also great quality like most black diamond products.
customer_reviews.author: austin jennings

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable once broken in
customer_reviews.text: First two climbs were a bit painful but once the shoes broke in I am absolutely in love. Very comfortable and for my first pair of rock climbing shoes these have been great.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick Plata

customer_reviews.title: They run very small. I'm a 10.5 and the 12's are tight.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but make sure you buy two sizes larger than you normally wear they run a bit small.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Go 2 sizes up
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is great once you find the right size. Im a 11.5 and had to buy a 12.5 to finally get the perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to climbing in these!
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide forefoot and wear 8.5 in street/hiking shoes. The 9.5 in these are a perfect fit for my feet. These shoes are pretty neutral but there is still a slight arch underfoot. My toes are pretty relaxed when the shoe isn't weight loaded, but once I stand in them, my toes are slightly curled up against the front of the shoe, but not painfully so. The shoes appear to be very well made, not surprising since it came from Black Diamond. Hope this helps especially when it comes to sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Z.

customer_reviews.title: I wear a 10.5 street shoe, I ordered a 10.5... it fit perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10.5 street shoe, I ordered a 10.5... it fit perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Dust4star

customer_reviews.title: New climber, I like them
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of climbing shoes, I ordered a size larger than my regular size and they are pretty tight but not too ridiculous. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Joey R

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner/intermediate climbers
customer_reviews.text: I started indoor bouldering in August 2018 and wanted something that wasn't overly expensive, but would still allow me to progress well. I love these shoes and they've been working great for me, sticking to tiny footholds and allowing me to feel where I'm putting my feet. I've been going to the gym consistently 2-3 times a week for about 3/4ths of the year and the wear isn't too bad, considering they've been put through hundreds of hours of wear. Great shoe for beginners and intermediate climbers.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Wang

customer_reviews.title: Sizes WAAAAY on the small side.
customer_reviews.text: One reason I rarely buy shoes of any kind online is because MFGs keep their sizes ALL over the board to the point its just insane. I barely wear an 11 and ordered 12.5 and they're not even close. Far too short, far too narrow. If I'd try again I'd try the 13.5....and again I wear 11s so when shoes are at least 2 1/2 sizes too small, maybe consider changing how you size shoes! YES I know these are climbing shoes and have break in periods but come on.
customer_reviews.author: Kent E.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe but lacks durability
customer_reviews.text: Had these shoes for less than 60 days and the toe already began to fray from indoor climbing sessions, dissapointing because i was really enjoying the fit of the shoe. I have reached out to Black Diamond about replacing or repairing the tear, will update later with results. Not sure if this falls into “regular wear and tear” or not, considering they didn’t even last two months!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Knechtly

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these at local stores, tried them and the friction was very bad!
customer_reviews.author: schstr slvn

product_meta.title: Black Diamond Momentum Lace Climbing Shoes Men ash 2019 Sport Shoes
product_meta.description: Built for unparalleled comfort during all day cragging and gym sessions, the Momentum Lace is a shoe that combines innovative technology with a classic, flat-last design. The result is an entry-level shoe that excels in performance. With an upper fabric that consists entirely of our Engineered Knit Technology, the Momentum Lace provides stretch where you need it, support where it matters and all around exceptional breathability. We've also added a micro-fiber liner to the front of the shoe to minimize stretch and maximize comfort. The Momentum's durable rubber is unique in that it's molded-inspired by the way we forge our carabiners-versus cut from one sheet of rubber. This is our engineered solution to optimize our shoe's rubber and rands for durability and comfort. Designed for all-day comfort on moderate routes, boulders or gym sessions, the Momentum features a soft-flex midsole for sensitivity and lace-up adjustability, making it the perfect entry level climbing shoe.
feature_bullets: Neutral, flat last for vertical climbing and all-day comfortEngineered Knit Technology upper provides exceptional breathability and comfort4.3mm rubber is built for durability and molded for optimal consistency and performanceSoft flex midsole for added sensitivity and comfortLace entry for fit adjustability
